May create new cities. Reduces city's [ICON_Citizen] Population by 1 when completed.
May create tile improvements or remove features like Woods or Rainforest. Builders can be used 3 times. This can be increased through policies or wonders like the Pyramids.
May make and maintain a single [ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Route. Automatically creates Roads as it travels.
May convert [ICON_Citizen] Citizens to their Religion. May not initiate theological combat with units of other Religions (but can defend).
May convert [ICON_Citizen] Citizens to their Religion and initiate theological combat with units of other Religions.
May eliminate the presence of other Religions in their territory, and initiate theological combat with units of other Religions.
Find and extract [ICON_GreatWork_Artifact] Artifacts from [ICON_RESOURCE_ANTIQUITY_SITE] Antiquity Sites to be displayed in their home city's Museum.
Performs secret missions in foreign cities and protects your cities from enemy Spies.
A late-game civilian who can create a single National Park to attract [ICON_Tourism] Tourists. Must be purchased with [ICON_Faith] Faith.
Each [ICON_GreatGeneral] Great General has unique abilities, including a passive effect, and a Retire effect. Visit the Great People panel to learn more, and track your progress.
Each [ICON_GreatAdmiral] Great Admiral has unique abilities, including a passive effect, and a Retire effect. Visit the Great People panel to learn more, and track your progress.
Each [ICON_GreatEngineer] Great Engineer has unique abilities when activated. Visit the Great People panel to learn more, and track your progress.
Each [ICON_GreatMerchant] Great Merchant has unique abilities when activated. Visit the Great People panel to learn more, and track your progress.
Great [ICON_GreatProphet] Prophets can found a Religion when activated. Visit the Great People panel to learn more, and track your progress.
Each [ICON_GreatScientist] Great Scientist has unique abilities when activated. Visit the Great People panel to learn more, and track your progress.
Each [ICON_GreatWriter] Great Writer generates a [ICON_GreatWork_Writing] Great Work of Writing when activated. Visit the Great People panel to learn more, and track your progress.
Each [ICON_GreatArtist] Great Artist generates a [ICON_GreatWork_Landscape] Great Work of Art when activated. Visit the Great People panel to learn more, and track your progress.
Each [ICON_GreatMusician] Great Musician generates a [ICON_GreatWork_Music] Great Work of Music when activated. Visit the Great People panel to learn more, and track your progress.
Fast-moving Ancient era recon unit.
Fast-moving Industrial era recon unit.
Weak Ancient era melee unit.
Ancient era melee unit that's effective against mounted units.
Strong Classical era melee unit.
Medieval era melee unit that's strong against mounted units.
Renaissance era melee unit.
Modern era melee unit.
Information era melee unit.
Modern era counter to cavalry class units.
Information era counter to cavalry class units.
Weak Ancient era ranged unit. Better on attack than defense.
First Ancient era ranged unit with a [ICON_Range] Range of 2.
Medieval era ranged unit.
Industrial era ranged unit.
Atomic era ranged unit.
Fast-moving Classical era light cavalry unit.
Fast-moving Industrial era light cavalry unit.
Fast-moving Atomic era light cavalry unit.
Classical era bombard unit, ideal for attacking cities. Cannot move and attack on the same turn unless they've earned the Expert Crew promotion.
Renaissance era bombard unit, ideal for attacking cities. Cannot move and attack on the same turn unless they've earned the Expert Crew promotion.
Modern era bombard unit, ideal for attacking cities. Cannot move and attack on the same turn unless they've earned the Expert Crew promotion.
Information era bombard unit, ideal for attacking cities. Cannot move and attack on the same turn unless they've earned the Expert Crew promotion.
Ancient era support unit. When adjacent to a city, attacking melee units do full damage to the city's Walls.
Classical era support unit. When adjacent to a city, attacking melee units ignore Walls and immediately assault the city.
Industrial era support unit. Can heal adjacent units.
Modern era support unit. Adds +1 [ICON_Range] Range to adjacent bombard strength units.
Medieval era support unit. Requires an Armory to produce. Can construct Roads, Forts, and Airstrip improvements.
Atomic era anti-air support unit. Provides cover from air attacks up to 1 hex away from the weapon.
Information era anti-air support unit. Provides cover from air and nuclear attacks up to 1 hex away from the weapon.
Hard-hitting, Ancient era heavy cavalry unit. Gains 1 bonus [ICON_Movement] Movement if it begins a turn on a flat tile with no Woods, Rainforest, or Hills.
Hard-hitting, Medieval era heavy cavalry unit.
Information era heavy cavalry unit that is fast and strong.
Fast-moving Modern era heavy cavalry unit that ignores zone of control.
Ancient era melee naval combat unit. Can only operate on Coastal waters until Cartography is researched.
Classical era ranged naval unit. Can only operate on Coastal waters until Cartography is researched.
Fast Renaissance era exploration melee naval unit.
Powerful Industrial era armored melee naval unit.
Highly advanced Information era ranged raiding naval unit that can be armed with nuclear weapons. Cannot be seen unless adjacent to it.
Modern era ranged raiding naval unit. Cannot be seen unless adjacent to it.
Renaissance era ranged naval unit with the ability to coastal raid. Cannot be seen unless adjacent to it.
Renaissance era ranged naval unit.
Atomic era melee naval unit that can transport air units.
Modern era naval ranged unit. Provides cover from air and nuclear attacks up to 1 tile away.
Strongest ranged naval unit, available in the Information era.
Strongest melee naval unit. Reveals submarines within sight range.
First air combat unit, available in the Modern era.
Atomic era Biplane upgrade.
First bomber unit, available in the Atomic era.
Information era Fighter upgrade.
Information era Bomber upgrade.
Ancient era primitive horseback warrior.
Ancient era primitive horseback archer.
Ancient era primitive naval melee combat unit.
Egyptian unique Ancient era ranged unit that replaces the Heavy Chariot. 4 [ICON_Movement] Movement when starting in open terrain.
Greek unique Ancient era unit that replaces the Spearman. +10 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength if there is at least one adjacent Hoplite unit.
Scythian unique Classical era unit. Ranged unit with 4 [ICON_Movement] Movement with a [ICON_Range] Range of 1.
Sumerian unique Ancient era unit. Stronger than all other starting units. No penalties against anti-cavalry units. 4 [ICON_Movement] Movement if this unit starts in open terrain.
English unique Industrial era unit when Victoria is their leader. +10 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength when fighting on a continent other that your capital's. No disembark cost.

American unique Modern era unit when Teddy Roosevelt is their leader. [ICON_Culture] Culture is earned from kills on their [ICON_Capital] Capital's continent. +10 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength when fighting on Hills. Lower maintenance cost.
Roman unique Classical era melee unit that replaces the Swordsman. Can build a Roman Fort.
Japanese unique Medieval era melee unit. Does not suffer combat penalties when damaged.

Norwegian unique Medieval era unit. 4 [ICON_Movement] Movement if this unit starts in enemy territory. +7 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength when attacking and -7 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength when defending.

Norwegian unique Ancient era naval unit that replaces the Galley. Can pillage enemy coastal lands and capture civilians if adjacent using its coastal raiding ability. 4 [ICON_Movement] Movement while in coastal waters.
Chinese unique Medieval era unit. Ranged unit with a [ICON_Range] Range of 1 and high combat strength.

Spanish unique Renaissance era unit that replaces the Musketman. +10 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength when there is a Missionary, Inquisitor, or Apostle in the same hex. If this unit captures a city or is adjacent to a city when it is captured, the city will automatically adopt the Conquistador player's Religion as the dominant Religion.

Russian unique Industrial era unit that replaces Cavalry. Stronger than Cavalry, and gains +5 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength when fighting in or adjacent to its home territory. Can move after attacking if [ICON_Movement] Movement points remain.
Indian unique Classical era unit that replaces the Horseman. -5 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength for all adjacent enemy units.
Kongo unique Classical era unit that replaces the Swordsman. +10 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength when defending against ranged attacks. Can move and see through Woods and Rainforest.
Arabian unique Medieval era unit that replaces the Knight. Heals at the end of every turn, even after moving or attacking.
English unique Renaissance era naval unit that replaces the Privateer. Can capture enemy ships. Cannot be seen unless adjacent to it.
French unique Industrial era melee unit. +10 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength when fighting on your capital's continent. [ICON_GreatGeneral] Great General points for killing units.

German unique Modern era naval unit that replaces the Submarine. Cheaper to produce, +1 Sight, and +10 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength when fighting on Ocean tiles. Able to reveal other stealthed units.
American unique Modern era air unit that replaces the Fighter. Gains +5 attack against fighter aircraft, has +2 flight range, and gains +50% experience.
Brazilian unique Modern era unit that replaces the Battleship. Stronger than the Battleship. Unlocked by Nationalism.
